intro: Hieracium axaticum, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and serrated. Its flowers are yellow, with ray florets that are often shorter than the central disk florets. Hieracium axaticum thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas.
